div.l: But faire and wele she crept into the clerke
And lieth full still and wolde haue caught a slepe
Within a while Iohn the clerke vp lepte
And on this good wyf lieth on sore
So mery a fitte ne hadde she full yore
He pricketh harde and depe as he were madde
This Ioly lif haue thes twoo clerkes hadde
Till the thrid cok be gan to synge
Aleyn wexeth wery in the dawnyng
For he hadde swonkyn all the longe nyght
And seide fare wele malyn my swete wight
The day is come I may no lenger a bide
But eủer more where so I go or ryde
I am thyn owne clerke so haue I hele
Nowe dere lēmman quod she fare wele
But or ye go oo thing I wil the telle
When that thou wendest home by the mylle
Right at the Entre of the dore be hynde
Thou shalte a cake of half a busshell fynde
That was y made of thyn owne mele
Which that I holpe myn owne self to stele
And good lēmman god the saue and kepe
And with that worde almoste she gan to wepe
And aleyn thought or it gan to dawe
I wil go crepe in be my felawe
And founde the cradill with his hande anoone
Be god qduod he all wronge haue I gone
Myn hede is toty of my swynke to nyght
That maketh me that I go not a right
I wote wele be the cradill I haue mys go
Here lieth the mylnere and his wyf also
Forthe he gothe a twenty Devyll way
Vnto the bedde there as the myln̉er lay
He wende to haue cropen by his felawe Iohn
And bi the myln̉er In he crepte anoone
And kaught hym by the nekke and softe he spake
And seide thou swynes hede a wake
For cristes Sake and here a noble game
For be that lorde that cleped is seynt Iame
As I haue thryes in this shorte nyght
Swyved the mylners dought̉er bolte vp right
Whiles thou haste as a cowarde bene agaste
Ye false harlote qduod this myln̉er haste
